content.description: Climb by straddling the arete and using the face. Great route because you can get a couple knee bars/no hands rests on very steep terrain.  Two fixed pins and decent gear options. Hard onsight but can be top-roped from Burn Signals anchor.
content.protection:
North Carolina Trad Rack. Small to Medium gear and two rusty fixed pins.

Two bolt chain anchor shared with Burn Signals left of Scorched Earth Defenses. Or sling a big boulder up top.
content.location:
On the far right of CAR WALL, look up and locate the first fixed pin near the arete.

Right of Burn Signals(5.10)

content.description:
This route is listed as a TOP ROPE ROUTE in the KELLEY guide

I recommend starting on Drive On (5.8) and traversing slightly cliff left after pulling the boulder start. It definitely adds more pump to this already pumpy TOP ROPE ROUTE. stay low as you traverse right on the horizontal that leads to back Drive On. Finish out on Drive On.

Great training route after leading Drive On.
content.protection:
Listed as 'TR' (Top Rope) in the Thomas Kelley guide.

Natural anchor.
content.location:
Climb 'Drive On' to set up a top rope on this route.

This route is on the far left of CAR WALL halfway up the gully.

content.description:
Start on DRIVE ON(5.8). After pulling the boulder start traverse cliff left as if you were going to climb the TOP ROPE route FLAT TIRE(5.10). Instead of traversing right onto Flat Tire continue to climb up the crack to the top. This traditional route protects very well.

There is a great horizontal to build an anchorin that provids minimal rope drag.
content.location:
Cliff right of Entertainment For Men

Same start as Drive On and Flat Tire

Continue direct instead of traversing right on Flat Tire.

content.description: Same start as Drive On(5.8) then follow the right angled seam. Subtle but solid gear and jugs help pump you out on the onsight attempt. Overhung steep climbing helps the pump factor and reminds me of Burn Crack(5.10c) on Practice Wall.
content.protection:
North Carolina Trad Rack. Micro to Large gear(BD#.3-#4), set of nuts (include some micros).

Natural anchor
content.location: This route starts the same as Drive On(5.8) and then follows the right angled seam/crack system.

content.description: Starting on Drive On is recommended if you want to add a little length to this route. From the Drive On start traverse cliff left until you get to the start of the BIG crack system cliff left of Passing Lane. Climb this feature to the top and get creative with a natural anchor. Protects pretty well but the climbing is not to straight forward. Study it well before attempting.
content.protection: Trad Rack - Large gear (hexes worked well), micro cam(s), medium cams. Natural Anchor - (sling a boulder).
content.location:
The biggest left most crack on CAR WALL.

Left of 'Flat Tire'.

content.description: Probably as good as Ooga-Chocka. If it was easier to get to, it would be on everyone's list of trad leads at Crowder's. Very boulder start. Solid nut placements protect opening moves, and can be placed by stemming off the adjacent boulder.
content.location: It's the obvious crack that splits the center of the wall

content.description:
Scorched Earth Defenses(5.10d)trad straddles the arete and utilizes some of the overhung face features.

Diesel(5.11-) starts on the face cliff right of Burn Signals(5.10) and cliff left of Scorched Earth Defenses(5.10d). Make your way up the face and climb direct to pull the overhung 'ear' ledge and continue direct to the top. This is a TOP ROPE route and is very sustained and great for training purposes. It is meant as a fun, hard variation. Get some!
content.protection:
Top Rope off of the Burn Signals anchor.

Bolted Chains (two opposing quickdraws)
content.location: Direct line between Burn Signals(5.10)sport and Scorched Earth Defenses(5.10d)trad.

content.description: Quickly becoming one of the favorite 5.10's on the West side of the mountain, this sport route is a great steep line through jugs with a technical section in the middle.
content.protection: Four bolts to a chain anchor. Gear can be placed between the 1st and 2nd bolt if needed.
content.location: Only bolted line on Car Wall. Right of Firestone.
